on our parish website The Liturgy of the Word The Liturgy of the Word consists of three readings and a psalm The First Reading comes from the Old Testament except during Eastertide when we hear from the Acts of the Apostles The Responsorial Psalm is taken from the Psalms or one of the scriptural canticles The Second Reading from the letters of the New Testament except during Eastertide when we hear from the Book of Revelation Finally the Gospel always comes from one of the four Gospels The First Reading is usually chosen based on its connection with the Gospel This arrangement highlights the unity of the Old and New Testaments and the history of salvation with Christ always at its center The Responsorial Psalm is chosen in close relation to the First Reading and is meant to foster a deeper meditation on Sacred Scripture The psalm draws out our reflection on God's salvific nature and deeds The Second Reading unlike the first is generally not intentionally aligned with the Gospel or any other reading Instead it offers examples of practical applications of how a life in Christ can be lived Though written centuries ago these readings are still fundamentally relevant for us today The Gospel serves as our primary encounter in the Liturgy of the Word with the life of Jesus who is the Word made flesh As such the Gospel is a saving message that is meant to be life changing Though seated throughout most of the Liturgy of the Word at the Gospel we stand in reverence and sing Alleluia a Hebrew expression of joy that means Praise the Lord The priest carries the Book of the Gospels slightly elevated from the altar to the lectern accompanied by altar servers carrying candles This procession underscores the solemnity of the Gospel In preparation to hear the Gospel we make a significant three fold sign of the cross on our forehead our lips and over our heart Accordingly we prayerfully ask for the Gospel to penetrate the whole of our being influencing us totally and taking firm root in our mind and heart such that we may always profess these saving words with our mouth Faithfully in Christ Fr David Weekend of October 12th and 13th 500 Dan Lautzenheiser 730 David Smith
